instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>
threads.message: Liquid damage. Arround <CHIP>U5410</CHIP> is all destroyed. I cannot put it back. I had to clean to remove short. So, can I do a bridg? 3V to <RESISTOR>R5419</RESISTOR> is enought?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>
threads.message: Not a good idea. Just run the 6 wires to make it work again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>
threads.message: At least to check if board power? I am not sure if there are more issues.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>
threads.message:
I am missing 3.3V S0. I have green light. First thing I checked is I have stable 3.42V but I am missing <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>. I reflowed SMC but no reaction.
What is next to check?

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> at 3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>
threads.message: Crap under or dead SMC. This board does not sound good :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>
threads.message: So, replace SMC and if doesnot work goes to the trash? I reflowed 2 times the SMC with flux but no reaction.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>

threads.message: Replaced SMC and still magsafe, but no <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>
threads.message: Any corroded resistors around the SMC? PPBUS present?
